intro: Ingonia digitata, commonly known as the digitate ingonia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, finger-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
